page.title: 09E.Horsley S. School 1
page.content: St Teresa's Convent is a fee-paying Roman Catholic school but girls of all denominations are accepted. Founded in 1928 there are now 360 pupils aged 11 - 18 years, of whom 140 are boarders with other pupils daily travelling from homes up to 20 miles away. Some of the boarders are English often with parents abroad on business; others are foreign nationals - Chinese, Lebanese, Nigerian, Spanish etc., whose parents wish them to have an English education. Fees for a day pupil are currently about Â£600 per term. A very broad based curriculum encompasses all the arts and sciences, as well as a secretarial course. There are excellent sports facilities.
